messages.subject: Question about "The Sword and the Same"
messages.msgSnippet: The original 1913 edition of this book, and a copy I have here of the Tuttle 1963 reprint, both have a fold out Synoptical Table of the Nengo between the two
messages.messageBody:
The original 1913 edition of this book, and a copy I have here of the
Tuttle 1963 reprint, both have a fold out "Synoptical Table of the
Nengo" between the two books, i.e. between page 179 (the end of "The
Sword Book ...) and page 3 (the beginning of "Book of Same).

I'm looking at a copy of "The Sword and the Same," the Holland Press
reprint (1979 printing) and it does not have this chart, not torn or
cut out, just not there. I'm hesitant to conclude that none of the
Holland reprints have the chart, so if anyone who has a copy of this
book could check for the fold out Nengo chart and let me know what you
find, my bibliographic curiosity will be satisfied. Holland reprinted
it several times starting in 1963, so tell me which printing you have,
and if there is or is not a Nengo chart. If you happen to have a copy
of the Tuttle reprint other than the 1963 - I'm not sure they printed
it more than once - and let me know the same information, I'd
appreciate it.

Please mail me directly at bridgeofdreams@..., no need to reply
to the list(s). I'll summarize the information for all.

Thanks,

Craig

--
Craig Harris
Books from and about Asia
www.bridgeofdreams.com
